para.text: In these regulations, the following terms have the meanings indicated.

For the purpose of administering the provisions of Transportation Article, §13-937, Annotated Code of Maryland, and defining a motor home under Commercial Law Article, §14-1501, Annotated Code of Maryland, a "motor home" means a vehicle:
Designed to provide temporary living quarters, built into as an integral part of, or permanently attached to, a self-propelled motor vehicle chassis or van; and
Containing permanently installed life support systems which provide at least four of the following facilities:
A potable water supply system including a faucet and sink,
Separate 110—125 volt electrical power supply, or
A "motor vehicle", as defined under Commercial Law Article, §4-1501, Annotated Code of Maryland, does not include a motor home as defined in this regulation.

section.heading: Registration Plate.
section.text: A motor home shall display a Class M (multipurpose passenger vehicle) registration plate.
